meanings.sent1: The doctor mentioned that the patient's subclinical condition did not show any visible signs.
meanings.sent2: The subclinical infection went unnoticed until a routine check-up revealed it.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was subclinical, the sneaky virus managed to stay hidden for a long time.
meanings.sent4: The subclinical nature of the illness was like a silent intruder in the body.
meanings.sent5: The concept of subclinical diseases can be tricky to grasp for some people.

meanings.definition: Below the threshold of clinical significance
meanings.sent1: Her subclinical blood pressure was not concerning to the doctor.
meanings.sent2: The slight pain was deemed subclinical and not requiring immediate attention.
meanings.sent3: The subclinical level of noise in the background was oddly soothing.
meanings.sent4: The impact of his words was subclinical but left a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The subclinical changes in temperature were only noticeable to a few sensitive individuals.
